p: Consequently, recent retrospective studies suggest that US-guided central venous cannulation can safely be performed in patients with a platelet count above 20 Ã— 10 9/L [ 28, 32, 33]. In a study with 604 CVC placements, in 193 patients with acute leukemia, manual compression to stop bleeding was required in eight patients, no major bleeding was observed [ 28]. However, this study missed a control group and the administration of prophylactic platelet transfusion was not standardised, resulting in high risk of bias.
